entries.name: Let's Talk Mental Health!
entries.description: Let’s talk mental health! Nicky shares helpful tips, resources, and personal insight into managing anxiety, burnout, and emotional struggles. This panel is all about understanding yourself and supporting others in a positive, encouraging space.

entries.name: Anthropomorphism in Undertale/Deltarune
entries.description: Long ago, two races ruled over Earth: HUMANS and MONSTERS. We know how the intro goes. One day, someone asked: Is there a deeper reason why there’s barely any humans in these games? How does a universe full of monsters end up feeling so human? A somewhat unserious exploration ensues.

entries.name: Hacker News from 39c3 and Beyond

For information on MTG cubes, please visit: https://youtu.be/P_v0CeKyodo
For information on this specific cube, you can view it at: https://cubecobra.com/cube/overview/wjbu

entries.name: A Journey for tea in Taiwan
entries.description: A journey into tea tends to be difficult: finding one's preferred types of tea, reputable vendors, what methods and tips and tricks there are to making tea, all of it may seem opaque. Some of this knowledge is nebulous, hindered by language barriers, and varies with an individual's background. What one knows as a tea drinker in the west, a tea drinker in the east, a merchant, a farmer growing it, all of them have differences. Why not hear from someone who's learn from the ground up, and been on the ground (or in this case, in the mountains) talking to all of them? Here I'll share what I've learned hiking the high cloud-shrouded mountains in Taiwan, in my pursuit to find good tea.

presenters.name: Ray Ting (Fox Tea Merchant 狐狸茶商)

entries.description: Bats and bat friends! Come meet up and share interesting bat facts! There will be a group photo afterwards, so bat fursuits are highly encouraged!

entries.name: Cybernetics, transhumanism, and furry ergonomics
entries.description: Do you want a real, functional tail? Or at least a robotic one? Dream of being more than human, err, less human? Relevant technologies, both biological and robotic, are progressing rapidly, with many not that far off. We will review some more developments in the heavily intertwined topics of AI, neuroscience, robotics, medicine, and more that are foundational to these ambitions. We will also have a light-hearted discussion of what challenges and opportunities might await a society of augmented humans and anthropomorphic creatures.

entries.name: Whipcracking101 - Safety & Basics
entries.description:
Welcome to whips! This is an ALL AGES introduction to bullwhips- the first 20minutes of the panel is a introduction to 
my interest in cracking, a summary of whip construction, and safety topics such as PPE and spatial awareness while 
using whips. 
For the rest of the panel I’ll be providing 6’ long bullwhips and safety equipment such as goggles and hearing 
protection. Participants will the separate into two or three lanes (panel room size permitting) for a few minutes each 
of one-on-one coaching on how to safely perform some basic cracks with whips.

Recommended panel runtime: 1 hour and 30 minutes

entries.name: Con History: From First Fandom to Furry Cons
entries.description: Winner of the 2024 Ursa Major Award for Best Nonfiction Work, the Con History panel returns to explore the roots of the convention scene. From the fans of the 1930s who formed the first proto-conventions and their fight to determine what the purpose of fandom should be leading up to the first Worldcon in 1939. The evolution of cosplay and filk music. How science fiction fandom gave rise to the comic, anime, and furry cons (like how Midwest FurFest emerged from the furry track at DucKon). To the modern furry and brony conventions and their innovations to the convention scene, fan music, and virtual events.

entries.name: Aquatic Furs Meet and Squeak
entries.description: Come meet your fellow aquatic furs! Cetaceans, pinnipeds, otters, water dragons, and all water leaning critters welcome to meet and discuss whatever comes up. If you swim, breathe water, or just enjoy days at the beach this panel is for you!

entries.name: Break the Design
entries.description: Come check out the metalcore act, Break the Design, perform at Further Confusion 2026! If you like crazy gutturals, catchy choruses, and noodly guitar solos, then you should definitely come check it out. Come here songs you've heard before (available on all streaming platforms :D) and come hear some brand new unreleased tracks! (not released anywhere yet :𐤧)

entries.name: Pin Trading Panel
entries.description: Come and bring your pins for a fun trading event! Most participants specialize in collecting and trading Fursona Pins, but all are welcome!

entries.name: Mostly Mammals
entries.description:
Innovative indie rock with teeth. If you like music, we make that!
Come dance and vibe as we celebrate our latest release and play a slew of originals LIVE on stage!

entries.name: Wings of Fire After Dark
entries.description: A space for adult Wings of Fire fans to meet and share their ideas and projects.

entries.name: I Feel Weirder: More Forbidden Pleasures from Classic Cartoons
entries.description: The 16mm projector’s glow will be our full moon, as Auryn returns to psychoanalyze their earliest fantasies while screening the classic cartoons that corrupted us as kids. This year, we'll have whistling wolf Daddies, enthralling maws, manic pixie squirrel girls, deconstructed ducks, balloon genealogy, and more! Bring your sublimated yearning, we'll bring the milk and cereal!

entries.name: Foraging for Plants and Mushrooms!
entries.description: Have you ever wanted to get into foraging but were stopped by certain barriers of entry? Or maybe you just want to get to know your local plants and mushrooms a little better! I'd love to give you the tools you need to do these things without poisoning anyone!

entries.description: A furry Certified Public Accountant goes over the basics of how taxes work in the U.S. and then answers any questions you have!

entries.name: Getting (Back) Into Traditional Art
entries.description: Do you want to try physical art media, but don't know where to start? Do you find your attempts are barred by things like money, time, space, and lack of knowledge? This is the panel for you. Join experienced traditional artist M. Cromwell (Marandart) and Sasha Jones as they tackle common roadblocks, provide resources, and offer inspiration to move your art practice from the screen into the physical world.

entries.description: #FREEJAZZHOUSEPARTY will be playing an eclectic set of music for your listening pleasure featuring contemplative lo-fi, fiery free jazz, ambient minimalism, and the avant-garde to create an atmospheric retreat for convention attendees.

From charades and furry trivia to creative drawing contests, every round promises laughs and surprises. Cheer on the contestants as they compete for fun prizes, and don’t miss your chance to win as part of the audience. entries.description: A place to learn about various kinks, define key terms, answer questions and even see/participate in some demos! Wallflowers are welcomed as this is a safe space for all folks of varied identities and experience levels.  Positive reinforcement is given to those who are brave enough to participate!

entries.name: 🤘 Metal Furs Meetup 🤘
entries.description: Are you a furry who likes death metal (or any subgenre of metal music)?? Then rock out with us at this panel! We'll be hanging out, sharing music, co-creating playlists, and making space for fellow creators (like you!?) to tell us about their bands.

entries.name: The Art of Storytelling
entries.description: The ability to craft wonderful stories is one of our greatest gifts. Come and explore some of the finer points of storytelling expertise, including delves into the storytelling wisdoms of Zootopia, Watership Down, Totoro, and a pair that feature raccoons.

entries.name: Inflatable Suit Tryouts
entries.description: Come on over to the inflatable suit tryouts and you can be big and round and also turn into a living pooltoy. Feel free to bring your own inflatable suits for more opportunities for victims- I mean volunteers.

entries.name: Hacking and networking adult toys
entries.description: Following the progression of other consumer devices, it's now entirely typical for adult toys to have USB charging, bluetooth-connected mobile apps, and cloud interfaces, many with APIs. But why suffer with the limited experience these companies offer and the numerous associated privacy concerns? This panel will cover some of the exciting recent developments in the homebrew and small-business kink community and showcase several specific devices as in-depth case studies.

entries.name: Fursuit Maker Thread Talk
entries.description: We're talking about the scary stuff. Setting boundaries, building a good TOS, and the big bad queue hole. Join other suit makers and share your stories about the ugly side of this craft.

entries.name: Lets Dance! Parapara 101
entries.description:
Parapara is a style of Japanese line dance popularized by Gyaru culture thats preformed to HI-NRG/Eurobeat. It's believed to have started in the late 1980's at a discothèque in Tokyo’s Shinjuku district. since then, parapara has gone through different waves in popularity each with their own distinct marks in moves and fashion.
In this panel we will discuss the origins, phases and history of the dance briefly and then a demo will be ran along with dance instruction:3c

entries.name: What is a CGD? (Species community panel)
entries.description: Do you like dragons? Want to know more about a adorable fluffy alien race of dragons that’s walks the earth today? Come join us and find out what CGD (celestial guardian dragon) even means!

entries.name: Murder at the Cove
entries.description: You been invited to a party at the cove, near a famous beach. Dale Cave is throwing this party and all the stops have been pulled. Till Dale is found dead, it is up to you to find the murder before they strike again. Can you do it and handle bad puns? Then come check out this all ages murder panel, it is  to die for. All ages are accepted so please keep things at a PG rating.

entries.description: Calling all adventurers from across Eorzea & beyond! This panel offers a unique opportunity to celebrate the intersection of two vibrant worlds: the captivating realm of Eorzea and the diverse, creative world of furry fandom.

entries.description: Looking for hot furry singles in *your* Fandom? Rules are simple: 5 min dates, be respectful, show up early, dress light (it gets hhhot!!!) Cold drinks and snacks included

entries.name: Storytelling After Dark
entries.description: Can storytelling still be present when the material turns towards things often considered risqué or intense?  Come and explore some of the points of storytelling expertise that can be maintained even as the lights are turned down low.

entries.name: Asexual and Aromantic Spectrum Meet & Greet
entries.description:
Do you know what Asexuality and Aromanticism are, or want to find out? Are you Ace-spec or Aro-spec, and want to share your experiences with other furs? Or are you interested in meeting some Ace and Aro furs and learning how to best support your friends? Come learn from Ace and Aro furs about how they experience (or don’t experience) attraction, and how that fits into their identity.

This is a safe space, open to those anywhere on the spectrum, questioning their identity, and allies. This panel will discuss mature topics, without being explicit or graphic.

entries.name: A Brief and Furry History Lesson
entries.description: Want to learn more about fandom history? A brief (but informative) survey of general fandom history.

entries.name: From Turing to Toasters: Artificial Intelligence’s Past, Present, and Future
entries.description:
ChatGPT, DeepSeek, Grok... You hear the names everywhere, but what is actually going on inside the black box?

In this panel, we’ll uncover the “magic” of AI. We will explore how they work (at a high level, no math!), where they came from and where they are headed, and most importantly, what they can (and can’t) actually do. We will also discuss the ethical and philosophical debates surrounding the technology.

Join us for this intuitive introduction to the past, present, and future of Artificial Intelligence, and find out exactly how this tech connects to the furry fandom!

entries.name: How to own what you purchase
entries.description: We live in a world where music, films and even video games seem to be locked behind subscriptions, but does it have to be this way? Learn how to digitize and save your purchased media, scour archives and abandonware sites, and find out just why some numbers might be illegal.

entries.description: You've been to, heard of, or perhaps even seen a panel at almost every convention about attending YOUR first one. But what if there was one that, instead of being hosted by experienced ConStaff/attendees, was hosted by a first timer! eh, eh? *nudge nudge* pretty cool, huh?

Are you a military veteran? Are you active duty or a reservist? Then this is the panel for you. As a Navy Veteran and a furry, attending previous Veteran panels at other cons spurned me to keep up the tradition and to create a space for those who serve and have served.

(This is an all-ages event, so please make sure your plush is appropriate.)

The event will be two 90-minute timed rounds with the winners of each pod competing in a final, six-person pod for top prizes.  Additional prize support will be handed out randomly throughout the event.

entries.name: Demystifying AI
entries.description:
The broad field of machine learning has gotten a lot of traction in the recent years, with LLMs such as ChatGPT becoming the new express lane within the modern information superhighway. "AI" was even crowned TIME's "Person of the Year" this past year. But how do these technologies actually work?

In this brief crash course, we'll explore the very basics of artificial intelligence, starting with the humble Perceptron, and ending with Transformers (the very foundation that powers modern LLMs like ChatGPT!). My goal is to show the limitations and capabilities of this field as someone from a technical background, and to pierce through a lot of the "hype" that a lot of marketing around these products uses.

entries.name: Novel Writing 101: Preparation
entries.description: A novel is a huge undertaking, and it’s hard to keep in your head all at once. Before you start writing, there are a lot of steps you can take to make the writing easier. We’ll talk about how to pick the right idea, how to build a roadmap for your story, and (don’t be afraid) outlining. Whether you’re planning your first novel or looking to make the process easier for the next one, these ideas can help!

entries.name: Why Did That Suck?
entries.description: You ever try to have a serious conversation that went seriously sideways? Me too, it's the worst. Wanna do something about it? You're in luck! This panel will give a brief introduction to healthy communication, boundary setting, conflict resolution, and how to decide if someone is worth your energy.

entries.description: Join an apparel industry professional in a discussion on all things fashion! We'll give insight into the fashion industry, teach practical steps to elevate your style, and explore ways we can be more purposeful in our aesthetic inspirations and choices, all in an uplifting and supportive space. We encourage you to wear an outfit you love. This is a place to show off!

entries.name: Pokemon IRL
entries.description: Pokemon are fantastical creatures who’ll fight by your side and be your friend for life. Too bad they’re not real…or are they? Come learn about the animal adaptations from our world that inspired the world of Pokemon. From poisonous birds to waterfall-climbing fish, Pokemon are more real than you think!

entries.name: Mascha and the Swingin’ Tails
entries.description: Let Mascha’s vocals and the Swingin’ Tails’ rhythm and horns transport you to amazing places with their mix of jazz, standards, and the occasional surprise. Feel free to dance in the aisles -- our audiences often do!

entries.name: Live Bats!
entries.description: Bats! Often misunderstood, these little flappy guys fill many important ecological niches. NorCal Bats will be giving a presentation on Californian and other bat species, with special guests: live rescue bats for you to meet! Due to health and safety requirements, only photos are allowed - no bat hugs, even tho they're cute!

entries.name: Asian Furry Meet and Greet
entries.description: Are you Asian? Or you think you're Asian? Or do you want to make more Asian friends? Curious about the ritual that Asians gather around with their phone placed like a magic circle? Then join us for our Asian Fur Meet & Greet, the once wild RAD Asian furry party, now as official panels and still RAD! Come to connect with fellow Asian furries, explore Asian furry cultures, discover the secret to loving durian, and most importantly, have an absolute blast and fun time!

entries.description: Explore Bay Area transit with fellow furs! From BART’s Silicon Valley expansion and Caltrain’s electrification to California High-Speed Rail, good transit, urban planning, and the data that powers it all shape local communities, conventions, and the places we call home.

entries.name: Wolf Children (Movie)
entries.description:
RATED: PG
Summary: Hana marries a wolf man and raises their two children alone after he dies. They move to the countryside and the children have adventures in the woods and at school.
—come and bring some popcorn, your blanket, a plush and let’s get cozy and watch a nice movie tonight :)

entries.name: Wet Dog Comedy Presents: Short Form Improv Fur Beginners!
entries.description: Woof woof! Interested in learning the basics of short form improv? Come learn with your favorite furry college improvisers, hailing from UC Davis! You'll learn how to be witty on the fly, create engaging scenes, and become silly characters that people laugh at and relate to! Learning how to do improv is perfect for things like DnD, LARPing, interviews, and living life to the fullest! This will be a safe, empowering, no-judgement space where you can play improv games alongside us and discover your performing potential! This workshop is suited for improvisers of all proficiencies. We look forward to provin' with you! Rrrruff!

This panel is not from a pros perspective, but a working beginner hoping to share what she’s learned and make it a lil easier for others hoping to start!

entries.name: Blood on the Clocktower
entries.description:
Blood on the Clocktower is an award-winning social deduction game in the same family as Mafia, Ultimate Werewolf, Secret Hitler, and more. On the stroke of midnight, you hear a bloodcurdling scream, and you rush to find that your beloved town storyteller has been murdered! Only a demon could have committed such a vile act, and they must have had minions to help them.

It falls to you, the villagers, to save the sleepy town of Ravenswood Bluff using logical deduction and social investigation alike. Good players learn information with their special abilities that will help them figure out who is suspicious... but watch out, because there are reasons why this information can be unreliable. Meanwhile, evil players will need to be clever, sowing misinformation and discord to protect the demon until the town is destroyed. Just remember... in Ravenswood Bluff, death is not the end.

We will be playing the beginner-friendly edition of Blood on the Clocktower called Trouble Brewing, with anywhere between 7 and 20 players welcome. See you in the Bluff!

entries.name: Sonic the Hedgehog and Breaking Bad are the Same DX
entries.description:
I’ve come to make an announcement. People think Sonic the Hedgehog and Breaking Bad are totally different. Wrong! Chaos Emeralds? Dang it Marie! They’re minerals. Jesse we have to cook ... chili dogs. Join Rascal as he makes the crystal clear connection between two iconic fandoms. Vince Gilligan, you have some explaining to do.

Everybody is welcome, but remember, I am the one who knocks.

entries.name: Kemono Meetup!
entries.description:
Calling all kemonos and kemono fans! West Side Kemono (WSK) will be returning to host the kemono panel for not just kemonos on the west side, but kemonos all around! Get to know your local kemonos, as well as meet new kemono faces! We hope to see you all there!!

Group photo will take place 30 minutes BEFORE the end of the panel/meet.

entries.name: Deep Sea Trivia Game
entries.description: You think you know about the deep seas? You willing to back up that claim? Want to win some prizes? Test your knowledge in a 50+ question kahoot trivia game hosted by a marine biologist. Bring your phone to play, max 50 players: first come first serve.

entries.name: How to Produce an Indie Animation
entries.description:
Learn how to take sketches to screen, build community, and make your characters move hearts and tails alike.

Ready to bring your own critters and characters to life on screen? Join DizzyMingo and Niledile, co-creators of the upcoming furry indie animation Sol Search, for a deep dive into how to produce your own indie animation from scratch.

They’ll share best practices for independent development, including building a creative community, finding your audience, and structuring a production so your stories come alive efficiently and creatively. Along the way, you’ll get insider tips on workflows, collaboration, and keeping your characters—and your audience—at the heart of every frame.

Whether you’re an artist, animator, or storyteller, this panel will inspire you to hatch your ideas, animate your worlds, and share stories that move humans and furballs alike. Come for the practical guidance, stay for the fun, and leave ready to start your own indie adventure.

Learn best practices to:
Plan and structure an indie animation project – from first sketch to final render.
Build and nurture a creative community to collaborate with artists, writers, and voice talent.
Identify and reach your audience while sharing your stories in independent spaces.
Apply practical workflows and best practices for animation, illustration, and story development.
Bring characters and worlds to life with tips for maintaining creativity, passion, and personality throughout the production process.

entries.name: Werewolves, Shapeshifters, and Animal Transformation
entries.description: From the Epic of Gilgamesh to Turning Red, human to animal transformation has been a part of our culture, tradition, and stories. From early shamans and myths to folklore and fables to our modern comics and movies, there are countless stories involving transformation. Join us for an in-depth presentation as we look through the common tropes and elements, the different types of werewolves and werecreatures, and the modern TF community.

entries.name: Furry is "Fur" Everyone
entries.description: Come join a safe and welcoming discussion on some of the challenges faced by folks in the fandom, specifically misogyny, sexism, and transphobia/homophobia. Feel free to share your experiences with each other and build community, especially with our fellow female and trans furries.

entries.name: How to Organize in the Furry Fandom
entries.description: Do you feel distressed and powerless in the face of current events? As furries, what options are there to constructively build a future where we can all be safe and provided for? In this freshly illustrated and completely new rewrite our previous “Organize” talk, we will talk about the unique position of furry, and offer comprehensive ways we can work together to provide a joyful and meaningful future for everyone. Q&A and free zines after the talk!

entries.name: Keep Your Shit Private
entries.description: In a world that is increasingly online, it is easy to overshare which puts you and those you care about at risk. Come enjoy a lighthearted 18+ look into why it's important to keep your shit private online and some easy steps to take to keep yourself and others safe.

entries.name: Breaking the Cycle of Abuse
entries.description: Breaking the cycle requires courage, community, and access to safe pathways forward. This panel centers around the voices of survivors, offering honest conversations about healing, resilience, and reclaiming power. We'll laugh — we'll cry, and most importantly, I hope you will all leave this panel feeling a little more empowered than when you walked in. entries.name: Connecting Through Pain: An introduction to impact play
entries.description: Having a physical connection can be so much more than sex and cuddles! Impact play is the BDSM practice of creating sensations in another's (or ones own) body with strikes. Ranging from heavy pats to harsh whippings, there is no right way to approach this form of play. In this workshop we'll cover the breadth of experiences that can be derived from impact play, safety tools when approaching this kink, negotiation basics, common implements and much more. I will also be joined by Tiny Kitten Lia, an incredibly experienced bottom and general pervert. Together we will discuss the bottom perspective of impact and give a demo of basic and intermediate techniques for flogging, caning and hand impact, as well as general scene flow.

presenters.name: César / Sea ft. Tiny Kitten Lia

entries.name: Lapdancing 101 with DanceCoachScrlt
entries.description:
Let's learn a simple lapdance routine (after covering rules of consent!), and spice up the rest of the cons room parties! Bring a partner to alternate with, or come solo and be paired with another! I'll talk about how I've modified my moves from Virtual Reality, a few gotchas when doing a lapdance in a crowded room... and then well pair up in teams and alternate practice on each other! I've taught hundreds of students stage and lap dancing in VRChat... and I've been having fun teaching hundreds of you in the real!

(You may have seen her on a certain comedian's Furpocalypse Show; come see what all the fun is about ~~)

entries.description:

Existing players please bring your Mahjong sets to play!

entries.name: Kinky Side to Anime
entries.description: Kinky things in anime happen all the time. They tend to happen in ways that are funny but not true to life. When you come to our show you will learn what's happening, gain a good vocabulary and how things are done safely. We will have fun picking apart the kinky things, learning about them, and making sure everyone leaves there laughing and knowing more about what they want kink-wise, or at the very least entertained and educated!!! We are so excited to teach and entertain you!

Hope you're all ready to meet up with your fellow hunger-enthralled enthusiasts, because the vore meetup is back again! entries.description: Whether you are dildo curious or an experienced hole explorer, finding the right toys, exploring your own body and introducing them into partnered play can be daunting and intimidating experiences. In this lecture we will cover body safety of sex toy materials and hygene practices and what to look for when shopping.  Insertables also go far beyond solo play. We will also cover creative ways of introducing insertables for partnered play, common misconceptions of their impact in sex, and how they can aid in sex when there are changes in people's health and bodies.

There will also be some bug-themed goodies passed out, so make sure to bee there!

entries.description: Do you partake in endless discussions about the best series, movie, captain? Philosophical debates about post-scarcity queer space utopia over root beer? entries.name: Mindfulness and Meditation
entries.description: Being present and mindful is at the heart of nearly every philosophical tradition and is at the core of bringing peace of mind to lives. This workshop will introduce the fundamentals of mindfulness and philosophical ontology, teach practices that are useful for centering ourselves and bringing possibility to everyday situations, discuss letting go of our barriers to create who we want to be, and includes a short mindfulness meditation.

entries.description:

Pods will be assigned upon sign-up.  Maximum 16 players (four pods) will be accepted.  Sign-ups are first-come, first served.  Sign-ups will open roughly one hour before the event's start.  For those who do not have an Oathbreaker deck but want to partake, we'll have loaner decks available.

The event will be two 60-minute timed rounds with the winners of each pod competing in a final pod for top prizes.  Additional prize support will be handed out randomly throughout the event.

entries.description: How do stories end up in magazines? Do I have to pay for an audio adaption? And who the heck is Shunn? Learn everything you need to know about submitting short stories, poetry, and nonfiction, the common mistakes submitters make, and even how to get paid!

entries.description: The Furries at Berkeley has created one of the first "academic" furry courses in the county. For this panel, we hope to present the hurdles and barriers we went through to create this university course. Moreover, we hope to summarize some of the topics we went through during the fall semester like neurodivergence in the fandom, consumerism and capitalism in the fandom, and other fun topics.

entries.name: Bi+ & Fur: Connect, Create, Celebrate 🖌️🌈🦊💬
entries.description:
Join us for a relaxed, low-key gathering celebrating Bi+ identities in the furry community! Bi+ & Fur is your den for hanging out, sharing stories, and connecting with fellow Bi+ critters, artists, and allies.

Bring your favorite creative outlet—drawing, writing, roleplay sketches, crafts, or just your notebook and thoughts—and spend time with people who get it. We’ll provide space and good vibes; you bring your creativity, stories, and your fursona flair.

💜 All are welcome — whether you identify as bisexual, pansexual, fluid, queer, unlabeled, questioning, or an ally.
💙 No crafting experience required—just a desire to hang out, connect, and share some furry fun!
💖 Let’s celebrate Bi+ joy, community, and visibility together.

entries.name: FC: Unleashed Dress Rehearsal
entries.description: Dress Rehearsal for all FC: Unleashed participants.

entries.name: Constructing Languages for Critters
entries.description:
Why can't an orca say "mom"? What would bird language sound like? Would a country mouse have a different accent than a city mouse?

Come learn the basics of constructing languages and learn about how animal physiology creates new possibilities for fantasy language. All experience levels welcome!

entries.name: Cult of the WAH! (Red Pandas and friends)
entries.description: Come join the Red Panda Revolution!  Connect with the all powerful WAH as we summon the power of fluffy tails and bring Red Panda joy and wisdom to all Red Pandas, Ringed tailed kin, their friends, and even the SNEP!  Find out what Red Pandas are, meet your fellow WAH's, and share in more WAHsdom!

entries.name: Basics of Avatar Creation in VRoid Studio
entries.description: Learn the basics of creating 3D avatars in VRoid Studio. VRoid avatars can be used as VTubers, VRChat avatars, and as rigged 3D models in other platforms. This panel will cover some best and worst practices as well as how to use creator resources like BOOTH and VRoid Hub.

entries.name: Why Do I Keep Seeing That Red Cape Wolf Everywhere: Furry Visual Novels And Why They're Cool As Hell
entries.description:
Though rooted in outside animation and comics, one of the most special things about the furry fandom is the way in which its stories come from within. Originating over a decade ago and having gone through explosive growth since, furry visual novels are a uniquely accessible medium that enables independent creators to bring richly-realized stories to an enthusiastic audience. Mostly, these involve hot wolves.

The first half of this panel will take you on a journey through time and genre to introduce the enormous diversity of furry visual novels. In the second half, we'll talk through the development of the visual novel UNDER | HEAVEN to show how you can even make your own.

entries.name: Trade 'n Swap Meet
entries.description: Trade or give away your unwanted trinkets! Figures, Games, T-shirts, Plushies, Stickers, Books, Comics, etc. Keep in mind, no sales. (Anything 'adult' should be in a clearly marked box)

entries.name: Jigsaw Puzzle Social
entries.description: Please join us for a fun, all-levels jigsaw puzzling social! Work on the big community puzzle, try puzzle chess, jump into puzzle sprints, and learn about competitive speed jigsaw puzzling (yes it’s a thing). Come relax, make fur-riends, and connect while piecing together puzzles made especially for the convention!

entries.name: Creating Your Art Style: Where to begin?
entries.description: Ever wonder how artists create the beloved art styles you view daily? Maybe from their inspirations? Natural gifts from within? Downloading that popular brush pack 🖌 Drawing from over a decade+ of experience, I will present the concepts and practical methods by which you (yes, YOU) can render the art styles envisioned within your mind!

Whether you’re an improv pro or an aspiring amateur, everyone is welcome here!

entries.description:

Shorter pocket-program version:
Join us for our Main Charity Auction, where amazing items and one-of-a-kind fandom treasures go to the highest bidder! Raise your paws high to bid on items from plushies to art and everything in-between! Every bid helps raise funds to support our charity, [TBD]. entries.name: Novel Writing 102: First Draft
entries.description: Writing a novel is as easy as “start at the beginning, go on until you reach the end, then stop.” Or at least, it would be if you didn’t have anxieties, a job, family, friends, and other life issues to get in the way. We’ll talk about what pitfalls you might encounter and how to keep your momentum going.

entries.name: What the Perkele is a Moomin?
entries.description: Pleasingly round, extremely relatable, and deceptively hippo-like: Moomintroll has been delighting audiences all over the world since the 1940s. Learn all about Moomin and author/artist Tove Jansson in this panel, intended for longtime fans and those just dipping their paws in. A special surprise awaits you if you stick with the panel all the way through!

entries.name: Critterlympics: Beach Games
entries.description: Critterlympics, Further Confusion’s signature fursuit games event, returns again for another year - at the beach this time! - with more games to challenge and entertain. Forty contestants will be chosen at the beginning of the event to compete in teams playing games for random points and imaginary prizes! Which team will feel the thrill of victory? Who will face the agony of defeat? Join us to find out.

entries.name: Furry Streamer Meet and Mingle
entries.description: Join us for the Furry Streamer Meet & Mingle, a fun and welcoming space for furry streamers and fans alike! Connect, share experiences, and network with fellow creators. Whether you’re an established streamer, just starting out, or a fan eager to meet your favorites, this meet up is the perfect opportunity!

entries.name: Furries in Game Development
entries.description: Hosted by Shishibro and Sven Wesker of Team Sando, this panel will provide a sneak-peek preview of what's to come for the upcoming indie game, Rock E Rumble. Additionally, there will be a Q&A segment for aspiring game devs in the furry community.

entries.name: Hackerspaces and you! (A makerfurs panel)
entries.description: Join Pawprint Prototyping's membership for a discussion of how cool it is to have a collaborative community working towards hacking things better! We'll present some projects we've built, meet other hackers, and generally hang out.

entries.name: Furry Commissions 101-NSFW
entries.description: Have you heard of furry artists making bank every month but aren't sure how they did or where to even start? From YCHs and proper tagging, to finding your niche in the community.  Feylords, a professional artist herself, will take your paw and guide you into drawing furry fetish art.

entries.name: Freaks For Fiction 18+
entries.description: "Freaks for Fiction" is a speed-style interaction panel where anyone can sign up to stand on stage to talk about the fictional characters they simp for or have hyperfixations on! Original characters are also free to be included. Each person will have a chance to explain who their favorite character is and why they are so special, than will be asked 3 random questions based on a category of their choosing. The panel is completely +18 so the questions can be answered with funky and crazy responses!

entries.name: Stop The Bleed Training
entries.description: We face a reality where queer spaces like the furry fandom are a target for violence and hatred. Become empowered to protect the fandom and your community when emergencies happen. Learn LIFE-SAVING techniques to treat severe bleeding before help arrives. Content Warning: This presentation may include graphic medical images.

entries.name: Wisp's cool fanart show!
entries.description:
Come show off your favorite fanart! We will have stands for displaying originals or prints, and a projector for showing digital works.

Note: No bidding or sales will take place.

entries.name: Turntable Praxis: A Live Scratch Sparring Lab
entries.description:
Turntable Praxis: A Live Scratch Sparring Lab
Interactive DJ Workshop — Furry-Con Edition (Moderate Feral)

Turntable Praxis is a high-energy, community-driven scratch workshop where DJs and critters of all kinds jump into short, call-and-response “sparring rounds” to explore rhythm, timing, and playful musical competition. Inspired by skratchfight-style sessions, this lab blends turntablism with the expressive, character-driven fun of the furry fandom.

Participants will get paws-on experience with portable decks, trading quick scratch patterns like friendly duels—one creature lays down a phrase, another answers back with their own twist. These micro-battles are fast, collaborative, and welcoming, designed to help beginners learn the basics while giving experienced DJs room to show off their style.

We break the motions down in approachable, intuitive language: how to move with the beat, how to build a phrase, how to respond instinctively to another performer’s pattern, and how to express your sona’s personality through sound. Whether your energy is fox-fast, wolf-bold, dragon-smooth, or raccoon-chaotic, you’ll find space to play.

Whether you step up to the decks or cheer from the den, Turntable Praxis creates an inclusive arena where music lovers, fursuiters, and curious attendees can vibe together, experiment safely, and celebrate rhythm as a shared form of expression.

All species and all skill levels welcome. Bring your paws, claws, hooves, talons, or just your curiosity.

entries.name: Pokemon Go Meetup
entries.description: Since 2016, Pokémon Go has inspired people to wander, explore, and find community.  Come meet up with other trainers to make friends that traveled near and far! Trade for that Pokémon you have been looking for for ages.  Brag about your collection and your favorite Pokémon.  If your new to the game, or have been playing every day for years why not stop by!

entries.name: A History of Werewolves in the Western World
entries.description: Who doesn't love werewolves? But where do the come from, how did they get here, and when did they get, well, sexy? In this panel we'll answer these questions and more, exploring the werewolf traditions and literature of Europe and the United States from Classical Greece to contemporary novels, games, and film.

entries.name: THE (18+) DINOSAUR ZONE
entries.description: Why is a dinosaur panel 18+? Wouldn't you like to know, weather boy. Ever heard of dinosaur sex lakes? Didn't think so. Edward Drinker Cope and Othniel Charles Marsh—two old dead guys who shaped paleontology—did some seriously messed up stuff. Also, there's a T-rex named "Scotty." Come learn prehistoric nonsense!

entries.name: Floor Pizza - Stand-up Comedy
entries.description:
A comedic pony, known for his entertaining performances and knack for storytelling, takes the spotlight on stage to share what might be the fumiest 'tails' you will hear. With a twinkle in his eye and a mischievous grin on his face, the talented equine performer regales the audience with detailed accounts of real fandom events!

Discretion Advised - This event may contain some content that may be disturbing to some guests including coarse language, crude content and/or material or humor that may be seen as harsh, rude, or offensive.

enthusiastic and like-minded individuals. There are many haunches, hinds, and maybe even maws to be admired in continuing the tradition that began in 2007.

entries.name: Paws and Paint
entries.description:
All that con energy got you all wound up? Take a PAWS and paint with us! 

There are canvases, tabletop easels, pallets, brushes and acrylic paints available for about 50 people, so I would get here close to the start time.

entries.name: Hacking Through The Ages
entries.description: The DEFCON Furs show runners dive into the threats we face online, from targeted harassment to government surveillance, and explore practical strategies for threat mitigation. Come learn how to safeguard your community, your voice, and your very existence; reclaim control over your digital life; and build a resilient defense against those who seek to silence us. In these times, privacy isn't a luxury—it's a necessity.

entries.name: Furry Retrocomputing Show!
entries.description: Back bigger and better! Are you a fan of chiptunes, pixel art, and everything 8-bit? You may not realize these old boring business machines and feeble home computers hold important places in the history of the fandom, and are foundational to its early art and online communities. Come watch a slice of all this through the Demoscene, an instantly recognized but rarely noticed subculture dedicated to producing live multimedia computer art, all rendered in realtime. Witness a live showing on an array of computers new and old, from Ataris and Amigas to modern PCs, while learning about the evolution of the Demoscene and some broader computing history.
